content: आचारः [आचर्-भावे घञ्] {@--1@} Conduct, behaviour, manner of action or of conducting oneself; सदाचारः good conduct; नीच° &c.; लोकाचारविवर्जिताः <ls>Pt. 5. 40</ls> ignorant of the ways of the world. {@--2@} Good conduct or behaviour; <ls>Bg. 16. 7</ls>; <ls>Ms. 1. 109</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">5. 4</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">3. 165.</ls> {@--3@} A custom, usage, practice; तस्मिन्देशे य आचारः पारंपर्यक्रमागतः <ls>Ms. 2. 18</ls>; <ls>Y. 1. 342.</ls> {@--4@} An established usage, fixed rule of conduct in life, customary law, institute or precept (<ab>opp.</ab> व्यवहार in law); आचार्य आचाराणां <ls>K. 56</ls>; <ls>Ms. 1. 109</ls>; <ab>oft.</ab> as the first member of <ab>comp.</ab> in the sense of ‘customary’, ‘usual’, ‘as is the custom’, ‘according to form’, ‘as a formality’; °पुष्पग्रहणार्थं <ls>M. 4</ls>; see °धूम, °लाज below; °परिकर्मन् <ls>Ś. 2.</ls> {@--5@} ({%a%}) Any customary observance or duty; °प्रयतः <ls>V. 3. 2</ls>; गृहाचारव्यपदेशेन <ls>U. 3.</ls> ({%b%}) A form, formality; आचार इत्यवहितेन मया गृहीता <ls>Ś. 5. 3</ls>; <ls>Mv. 3. 26.</ls> ({%c%}) The customary salutation or bow, usual formality; आचारं प्रतिपद्यस्व <ls>Ś. 4</ls>; <ls>V. 2</ls>; अविषयस्तावदाचारस्य <ls>Mv. 2.</ls> {@--6@} Diet. {@--7@} A rule (of conduct).
